hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Vacuum Reversal in BTC/ETH Pair
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL market regime, extreme compression of the BTC/ETH cross pair volatility (7-day realized volatility < 25th percentile of its 1-year history) followed by a breakout on expanding volume (>1.5x 20-day avg) signals the return of directional liquidity and provides a high-probability trend-following opportunity in the breakout direction.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Post-liquidity shock, cross-pair volatility compression indicates a standoff and a vacuum of directional conviction. A high-volume breakout from this compression represents a decisive influx of new capital taking a view, breaking the stalemate. In a NEUTRAL regime, this new liquidity tends to persist, creating a short-term trend.
entry_conditions: BTC/ETH 7-day realized volatility drops below its 1-year 25th percentile
Pair breaks out of its 7-day high/low range
Breakout day volume for both BTC and ETH is >1.5x their respective 20-day averages
Enter in the direction of the breakout at the next 4-hour candle open

exit_conditions.take_profit: Trend exhaustion: 5-day RSI(14) of the pair crosses 70 (if long) or 30 (if short)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Breakout failure: Price closes back inside the prior 7-day range
exit_conditions.time_exit: Close after 7 days if neither TP nor SL is hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The win rate for breakout direction trades is < 52% OR the average winner is not larger than the average loser (profit factor < 1.1).
